Futsal Strategy

April 30, 2021
futsal Free-styling

Foot Control and Coordination A good soccer player should have sufficient foot control and coordination to strategically pass the ball to their teammates or score the winning goal. Mini soccer balls will help you get used to kicking a smaller target, eventually making it easier for you to control a traditional soccer ball as well. A few drills you can perform with mini soccer balls to improve your foot control and coordination are: Kicking the mini soccer ball between your feet: This drill is fairly self-explanatory, but some call it “bells” or “foundation”. The ball moves quickly back and forth using the insides of your feet. When you force yourself to improve your precision with a smaller ball, it’ll make a regular game ball huge by comparison, thus improving your precision with that ball as well. This drill can even be done with a tennis ball if you want! Juggling the ball between your feet: This is a more advanced version of merely kicking the ball between your feet. To juggle, use a specific routine while keeping the ball in the air – such as using the left foot only, the right thigh, right foot only, and so on! Keep practicing the same juggling routine until you perfect it, then do another. Passing the ball to another player: One of the best ways to practice your foot control and coordination with a mini soccer ball is to have a teammate do it with you. Not only will you enjoy the camaraderie, but it will also help both of you improve your foot coordination while passing the ball between one another. You will be sharpening your striking skills as well as your receiving. Kicking the ball between miniature cones: Not only will kicking a ball between cones improve your agility, but it will also improve your control of the soccer ball in traffic! Practice cones are easy to find – check out these Pro Disc Cones.
